comment: He's alright, but there is a lot of stuff to do outside of class (such as seeing plays or rehearsing scenes or reading entire plays). All of that would be fine if he gave you a heads up on these things instead of telling you the class before these things are due.

Freddie is funny and tells a lot of stories. Books only used like 3 times. Attendance affects your grade so show up! Scene work is done, and even a bit of writing due to journals and theatre critiques. You will have to go see shows and practice outside of class time. Tests are hard if you don't open your book at all. Expect to work with classmates.

Freddy is a great professor and director. The assignments are always clear and the grade you get is definitely the grade you earned. The books aren't a huge deal, but attendance will determine your grade. Br prepared to spend a little money and time outside of class rehearsing. Loved this class.
Freddie Ashley is a fantastic teacher, acting coach, and director. His award-winning directoral experiences make him one of the best professors ever.

Fantastic Director!!  The class is a lot of fun, but can be challenging at times.  This is not a theory class, it is an acting class so be prepared to act every class period - your grade depends on it.  :)

professor ashley's class is a good class and he tries to make it as fun as possible. show up to every class! especially the days when you have group days. tests and quizzes are easy as long as you pay attention and the final project took some work and time out of class but was a lot of fun.

Attendance mandatory but the class is still fun and fairly easy. The main part of your grade is from the 3 events you have to see and your group project. If you do well on both of these then you should be fine.

Attendance is mandatory (worth points). Class had lots of guest speakers exam questions from them. MANDATORY theatrical events. My class an event sold out and i had to pay $50.00 to go see an off-campus event! I made an A, but it was just a LOT of busy work. There are 3 exams and you final is to put on play. An "A" is def. possible w/a littl effort

don't need book most of time cause goover chap in class. tests are easy, all material is in notes. pay attention to those random videos/visuals, usually some are on test. assignments not hard as long as follow instructions. teacher bit corky, but still is a stickler to his own rules.  offers extra credit.

Very nice teaher - kept the class interesting - mandatory attendance on group project days, but will miss notes for quizzes if you miss  on other days - quizzes do-able if you study notes - reports easy to do - graded easy - just do what you're supposed to - easy A - and enjoyable!

Such a funny guy! Go to class and take notes. quizes can be tricky without knowledge of the course lectures. Group project is the final to make your own play. very fun. There are fieldtrips to random plays and be detailed on the reports he asks for.
Funny, very interesting, interacts alot. If you come to class and listen there is no way you can fail.
